front.title: Schnorr NIZK Proof: Non-interactive Zero Knowledge Proof for Discrete Logarithm

abstract.t: This document describes the Schnorr NIZK proof, a non-interactive variant of the three-pass Schnorr identification scheme. The Schnorr NIZK proof allows one to prove the knowledge of a discrete logarithm without leaking any information about its value. It can serve as a useful building block for many cryptographic protocols to ensure the participants follow the protocol specification honestly.
